ygData.subject: Re: Mesmerize
ygData.msgSnippet: Sorry to let you know but that s not how mesmerize works. It stuns the creature and confuses their hate list. I did it on a rabid wolf in the hills the other
ygData.messageBody:
Sorry to let you know but that's not how mesmerize works. It stuns the
creature and confuses their hate list. I did it on a rabid wolf in the
hills the other day and after it wore off the wolf just walked off
like it never saw me which goes to prove that mesmerize does work
better than lull except the mana cost is higher and so may the chances
of it being resisted. But either way a 30 second stun is much much
better than a 3 second one. Personally I have never even memorized
lull althought I do have it because I am a perfectionist and feel I
have to have all the spells. I most likely won't use soothe either but
I will buy it.


>From: "Brian Rittermann" <bpr@...>
>
>You couldn't use it in the same way because you are on their hate
list when
>you cast mesmerize on them. After they are unstunned they will come
>rampaging after you.
>
>Lull does NOT put you on their hate list.
>
>Loreweaver
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
>To: eqenchanters@onelist.com <eqenchanters@onelist.com>
>Date: Tuesday, April 20, 1999 11:32 PM
>Subject: [eqenchanters] Re: Mesmerize
>
>
>>From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
>>
>>So why couldn't you Mesmerize 2 and pull the third? It sounds like
from
>>what you said it would make more sense. Instead of only having 3-7
>>seconds you would have 30. Wouldn't this work?
>>
>>---Ric Reichelt <redr@...> wrote:
>>>
>>> From: Ric Reichelt <redr@...>
>>>
>>> Yes they are very different. Mesmerize is a great spell for solo
or
>>groups.
>>> It basically stuns the creature for up to 30 seconds, allowing you
to
>>step
>>> back and cast, get away, or in a group scenario, you can mesmerize
one
>>or 2
>>> of the 3 creatures attacking your group, allowing the others to
kill the
>>> one that remains unstunned. Do note, once u hit it, or cast a DD
or DoT
>>> (Direct Damage or Damage over Time) spell on it, it's no longer
stunned.
>>> Lull makes the creatures less aggressive for a VERY short period
of time
>>> (2-4 seconds). This is useful when wanting to attack a camp of 2
or more
>>> creatures they you couldn't handle alone or grouped with others.
>>> Personally I didn't bother with Lull, but soon as I got Soothe (a
better
>>> Lull) my group and I started taking camps we would of normally
gotten
>>> slaughtered. My routine was, Soothe 2 of the 3 in the camp, while
another
>>> magic user would have the 3rd targeted. Once I Soothed the 2 (with
out
>>them
>>> resisting) I announced go, they would cast on the 3rd pulling it
out of
>>the
>>> camp so we could fight it with out the other 2 attacking us all at
once.
>>> VERY important, Soothe only last 3-7 seconds, giving just enough
time to
>>> Soothe 2 and pull a 3rd, so do not waste time and make it as fast
as you
>>> can else you'll end up pulling 2 or 3 vs. just 1.
>>> Hope this helps!
>>>
>>>
>>> Telan Ka'Rlaah of Rellos Zeke
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> At 05:19 PM 4/20/99 -0700, you wrote:
>>> >From: Brewhaus <brewhaus@...>
>>> >
>>> >Is mesmerize a better Lull spell or is it totally different? I
always
>>> >here people say "Use Lull." I always use mesmerize. Is that
bad? If
>>> >they are different could you explain why? Thanks,
>>> >
>>> >Aarreran, Mithaniel Marr
>>>
